text: Infection with the enveloped, acute-transforming oncogenic retrovirus, avian leucosis virus (ALV), results in a transient, PI3K-dependent phosphorylation of Akt as early as 15 minutes post infection. Moreover, treatment of cells with either PI3K inhibitor LY294002 or Wortmannin prior to infection significantly reduces viral replication in a dose-dependent manner [27] , pointing to a role of the pathway during the entry mechanism.
